item.description:

Selected works will be installed on concrete pads along the City’s trail system for a three-year temporary loan, creating a rotating collection of outdoor public art. A $5,000 honorarium will be provided to each selected artist. […]

item.title: Space Launch Delta 30 Issues RFI for Space Launch Development at SLC-14
item.description: Space Launch Delta 30 (SLD 30) at Vandenberg Space Force Base (VSFB) has announced a Request for Information (RFI) to solicit interest from United States Launch Service Providers engaged in space transportation services. This initiative aims to develop heavy or super-heavy vertical space launch vehicle capabilities at Space Launch Complex-14 (SLC-14), located near VSFB’s southernmost point.
item.source:markdown:
Space Launch Delta 30 (SLD 30) at Vandenberg Space Force Base (VSFB) has announced a Request for Information (RFI) to solicit interest from United States Launch Service Providers engaged in space transportation services. This initiative aims to develop heavy or super-heavy vertical space launch vehicle capabilities at Space Launch Complex-14 (SLC-14), located near VSFB’s southernmost point.
![For more information on VSFB or SLD 30, contact SLD 30 Public Affairs at (805)606-3595 or sld30.pa.workflow@us.af.mil.](https://media.defense.gov/2025/Dec/29/2003849489/300/300/0/251211-X-IN231-3185.JPG)

item.title: Space Force Officer Leads DAF Women’s Rugby Team to Historic Championship Victory
item.description: U.S. Space Force Maj. Adekunbi Adewunmi, stationed at Vandenberg Space Force Base, Calif., made history by coaching the Department of the Air Force (DAF) women’s rugby team to their first-ever championship victory at the Royal Australian Air Force, Royal New Zealand Air Force, and U.S. Department of the Air Force (ANZUS) Shield tournament at Whenuapai Air Base, New Zealand, Oct. 9-11.
item.source:markdown:
U.S. Space Force Maj. Adekunbi Adewunmi, stationed at Vandenberg Space Force Base, Calif., made history by coaching the Department of the Air Force (DAF) women’s rugby team to their first-ever championship victory at the Royal Australian Air Force, Royal New Zealand Air Force, and U.S. Department of the Air Force (ANZUS) Shield tournament at Whenuapai Air Base, New Zealand, Oct. 9-11.
![U.S. Space Force Maj. Adekunbi Adewunmi, second from left, stands with the Department of the Air Force (DAF) women’s rugby team during the playing of the U.S. National Anthem at the Royal Australian Air Force, Royal New Zealand Air Force, and U.S. Department of the Air Force (ANZUS) Shield tournament held at Whenuapai Air Base, New Zealand, Oct. 9-11. Adewunmi, stationed at Vandenberg Space Force Base, Calif., made history by coaching the DAF team to their first-ever championship victory at the tournament. (U.S. Air Force photo by 1st Lt. Kate Anderson)](https://media.defense.gov/2025/Dec/27/2003849171/300/300/0/251011-F-LV958-2026.JPG)

item.title: Chumash Casino Resort’s ‘Project Pink’ Campaign Raises $10,083
item.description: SANTA YNEZ, CA – The Santa Ynez Band of Chumash Indians presented a check for $10,083 to the Breast Imaging Center at Goleta Valley Cottage Hospital to help the non-profit deliver superior care to its patients through ultrasound screenings, mammography and biopsies. The donation is part of the Chumash Casino Resort’s annual ‘Project Pink’ campaign, which showcases expertly crafted pink food and beverage creations, all in honor of Breast Cancer Awareness Month.

item.description: Vandenberg Hosts Base Tour for San Luis Obispo Chamber of Commerce at Vandenberg Space Force Base, Calif., Dec. 19, 2025. The tour group was introduced to numerous facilities on base including the Space Launch Delta 30 headquarters building, Remote Launch Control Center, Pacific Coast Club, and Firefly Aerospace located at SLC-2. The tour provided details on Vandenberg’s various commercial partnerships, emphasizing its critical role in maintaining national strategic advantages in space.

item.title: Daily Memo: The Escalation Continues Before Christmas as ICE, HSI, and Border Patrol Set Record Raids Again
item.description:
In another record setting week, not only have the raids and kidnappings escalated, but so has the recklessness. The week saw more car chases, accidents, children placed in danger and separated from parents, more people detained and released, and new areas of Southern California targeted heavier than before like Antelope and Coachella Valleys.

The post Daily Memo: The Escalation Continues Before Christmas as ICE, HSI, and Border Patrol Set Record Raids Again appeared first on L.A. TACO.
item.source:markdown:
In another record setting week, not only have the raids and kidnappings escalated, but so has the recklessness. The week saw more car chases, accidents, children placed in danger and separated from parents, more people detained and released, and new areas of Southern California targeted heavier than before like Antelope and Coachella Valleys.

item.title: This 20-Year-Old Sawtelle Art Show Is Made of Over 2,000 Post-it Notes
item.description:
Every December, thousands of well-known and emerging artists from around the world scale down their work on three-by-three inch Post-it notes and display them at Giant Robot 2 in Sawtelle. “Everything’s the same price,” Giant Robot owner Eric Nakamura says. “It’s all $30 each, so it makes it more fun and kind of democratic.”

The post This 20-Year-Old Sawtelle Art Show Is Made of Over 2,000 Post-it Notes appeared first on L.A. TACO.
